turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I need to file an insurance claim. I had a car accident last week.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I am sorry to hear about your accident. I can certainly help you with filing a claim. To get started, could you please provide your policy number and the date of the accident?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, the policy number is ABC123XYZ and the accident happened on October 26th. Ugh, this is already frustrating.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you. I have located your policy. Could you please briefly describe what happened in the accident, including any injuries or damage?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Well, I was rear-ended at a stoplight. My car has significant damage to the rear, and I have some whiplash. The other driver admitted fault. I've already gotten a police report.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Understood. Please provide the police report number and the other driver's insurance information, if you have it. Also, have you already had your vehicle assessed for damage?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Yes, the police report number is 12345. I have the other driver's insurance information, too - it's with Defend Insurance. I haven't had my car formally assessed yet, but do I need to use one of your approved shops? That's always a hassle.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: You are generally free to choose your preferred repair shop, as long as they meet industry standards. We have a list of preferred shops you can choose from, but this is not mandatory. Now, to proceed, can you upload the police report and the other driver's insurance information as PDFs?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, I've uploaded everything. Thanks for the help so far. I hope this process goes smoothly.
